title: how to force firefox to search from web page on a new tab, not the address bar, not search bar.
content:
Considering how many closed/archived threads there are about this, you'd think it'd be fixed by now.

There have been add-ons like "New Tab Homepage" that worked to correct this but every time there is a solution, an 'update' corrects the 'problem' by forcing the search engine back to the toolbar.

After many years of trying solutions I've come to the conclusion that this is a deliberate 'feature', much like the many completely useless 'features' added to Windows for reasons known only to Microsoft, and the companies they share your data with.

Someone prove me wrong, please.
creator: justmehereathome

title: Drag & drop not working (since 2-3 weeks ago)
content: Hello! To create my website newsletters, I simply dragged the items from Firefox to the HTML editor and it inserted them without any problem, even keeping the links. For me it was perfect. But since an update about 3 weeks ago, it no longer works. When dragging, I get the "forbidden" icon. I can still do it from Chrome, but a)it's not what I want and b)chrome doesn't copy the links. What has changed, or what can I do? I am using Windows 10 Edge also copies the item, but without the links, as Firefox used to do.
creator: ampos

title: How Can I Fix Low Volume on Youtube:  What Happened to My Java Script?
content: My volume on Youtube is often too low. Some time back I got a java script that fixed it. I had to do an F12 and paste it in somewhere and then I got a little rectangle at top left which said something like 'volume'. Click on that and up went the volume. Click again, up more and so on. It was good. Sometimes on things like perhaps Bitchute it wouldn't work. It would actually switch all the volume off. I'd refresh the page to fix that. Anyway: it suddenly disappeared today. The little rectangle is gone. I can't up my volume on Youtube any more. I got something from the web, a javascript, and pasted it into 'console' after F12 but i got error messages. I'm clueless. Don't know where to look for my original, see if it still there. Don't know how to troubleshoot. Don't know any other way to get the volume up. See error message on the console whenever I go there, don't know what to do about them. FYI I'll post the first few lines of them: Unknown property ‘-moz-osx-font-smoothing’. Declaration dropped. screen.4472f725724c6a0a.css:1:3751 Unknown property ‘zoom’. Declaration dropped. screen.4472f725724c6a0a.css:1:6665 Unknown property ‘zoom’. Declaration dropped. screen.4472f725724c6a0a.css:1:14230 Unknown property ‘zoom’. Declaration dropped. Don't know what that's about. But mainly: how to get my volume up?
creator: abrogard

title: All searches give 3 - 5 "results" & duplicate them until I reach "no more results"
content:
I have been trying to find a solution for this problem for several months with zero results.

I use duckduckgo search. No matter what I search for, or how I word it I get "results" from 3 - 5 websites (2 of which are usually amazon & youtube - even though I'm not shopping or looking for a video). None of the non-results are remotely relevant, but they are the only results I get... Duplicated... Until I hit the "no more results" brick wall. And speaking of youtube... When I am looking for a video (audiobooks usually) my "results" consist of 3 or 4 channels (always the same 3 or 4). I get several videos from each of the channels & duplicates of those same videos then I slam up against the "no more results" brick wall.

I've cleared caches & cookies & stored data. I've deleted search history, cleared search history, paused search history, etc... Those things produce no changes whatsoever. I searched (at a friend's house on her computer) for information. The results might or might not have been relevant. It involves inserting great huge heaps of java-script into my machine. In spite of being computer illiterate, I'm not stupid. So, no I didn't copy or paste any script or download anything.

Everything I know about computers I had to figure out for myself. The most important discovery I made is that the way computers function is perfectly logical - frequently unreasonable, but always logical. That's why although I am computer-illiterate, I'm not computer-dysfunctional. I've been able to make laptops, tablets & android phones do things the experts & professionals said were impossible. But if people try to explain stuff to me by speaking computer code, all I hear is whah, whah, whah (like in the way grownups talk in the Charlie Brown cartoons).

I sincerely appreciate any information or suggestions anyone can offer. Just give it to me in plain english. I'm an intelligent adult who grew up in a socially-insignificant school district.

Thanks in advance to all!
creator: kris_the_ghost

title: Problems with Instagram
content: Up until some time last week, Instagram was working fine for me on the PC. I could pull up pages and scroll through the pictures and videos just fine....and I still can. However, I used to be able to click on a picture and the picture would sort of pop forward and I could see all the comments and there were direction arrows on either side so I could move to the next or last image. That is no longer the case. If I want to see the image a bit bigger, or read or add comments, I have to right click on the image and open in a new tab. The new tab will show the image and comments but there are no arrows to move to next or last image. Not sure what has happened. If it is something to do with Firefox or if it is a problem on Instagram's end. I can still use instagram and view images etc, but a lot of the ease of using it has disappeared.
creator: Ashkevron
